                       <a href=" http://www.prominy.com/les.htm" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.prominy.com/les.htm</a>                 

            LPC Electric Distortion & Clean Guitar Updates ver.1.04    
                        (requires Kontakt2.02 or later)                
                                   Includes:                           
                     -Real-time Legato Slide instruments.              
                      -Real-time hammer-on and pull-off.               
                  -?Repetition Auto-Alternation? instruments.          
           -5th-dyad chord (sustain + mute + picking noise) Velocity   
                              switch instruments.                      
          -Brush picking noise samples has been included in the chord  
                                 instruments.                          
               -?Down picking and Up picking on a single layer?        
              instruments are available in single note, 5th-dyad,      
                               4th-dyad, octave.                       
                         -?Faster attack? instruments.                 
                          -?All chords? multi (.nkm).                  
                                                                       
            LPC Electric Distortion & Clean Guitar Updates ver.1.05    
                        (requires Kontakt2.02 or later)                
                                   Includes:                           
                        -Chords + mute (.nki and .nkm).                
                -The chord articulations include mute samples.         
                -Realtime Legato Slide (Legato Script updated).        
           -With the legato .nki and .nkm, of ver.1.04, if a note-on   
              event was stopped by sequencer (stop button) before      
          note-off event, the legato .nki (or .nkm) no longer worked   
          correctly. (Canceling a note-off event caused the problem.)  
                     The issue has been fixed in ver.1.05.             
                                                                       
            LPC Electric Distortion & Clean Guitar Updates ver.1.51    
                        (requires Kontakt2.02 or later)                
                                   Includes:                           
                     -LPC Super Performance Multi (.nkm).              
                           -All Chords Multi (.nkm).                   
                                                                       
              LPC Super Performance Multi (.nkm) for Kontakt 2.11      
                                                                       
                           Sensitive and powerful,                     
             the true sound of GibsonÃ‚Â® Les PaulTM Custom includes      
                 over 60 Giga-bytes, approx. 150,000 samples.          
                                                                       
           Gibson&#039;s Les Paul Custom is the most supported and loved    
              electric guitar in the world. Its loved by so many       
           professional guitarists spanning generations and genres.    
          Over three months, we recorded the sounds of this excellent  
          electric guitar played by a top guitarist using the latest   
                        Digidesign ProToolsÃ‚Â® HD system.                
                                                                       
          Extreme power of expression that no one has reached before.  
                                                                       
          - A huge number of recorded playing styles that no one has   
                               captured before.                        
             - Over 60 Giga-bytes, 150,000 samples recorded from a     
                              single instrument.                       
           - You are able to create the most natural sounding guitar   
            tracks that sound like they&#039;ve been recorded by a live     
                      guitarist in a world class studio.               
                                                                       
           The world&#039;s most powerful and largest library of a single   
                             instrument includes:                      
                                                                       
            -Perfect sampled sounds of all fret positions on every     
                                  string*1.                            
          Single note, 5th chord, 4th chord, octave, vibrato, single   
            bend, unison bend, stationay bend, double bend, legato     
         slide, pinch harmonic, various chords, picking noises, etc.   
                                                                       
            - 243 .gig files which includes over 7,200 instruments     
           (clean: 121 gig files / 3600 instruments, distortion: 122   
                        gig files / 3600 instruments)                  
                                                                       
          You are able to get perfectly real expressions of the human  
           finger&#039;s legato slide up to the highest fret. This sound    
           library enables you to compose and create natural guitar    
                   tracks that imitate real guitar playing.            
                                                                       
                                 Legato Slide                          
                                                                       
             - A huge number of sampled legato slide techniques.       
            From Seminole (1 fret) to 1 octave (12 frets), multiple    
          tempos and velocity options for every single note, 5th-dyad  
             chord, 4th-dyad chord*2, and octave playing styles.       
                                                                       
                    - &#039;Real time Legato Slide instruments&#039;             
             Using Giga Studio 3.0&#039;s new feature, &#039;Legato Mode&#039;,       
                    you can enjoy real-time legato slide.              
                                                                       
                     *1: except some playing techniques.               
                                                                       
            *2: legato samples for 4th chord: 1 fret slide, 2 fret     
                  slide, and 3 fret slide are only available.          
                                                                       
            Various chords are played in multiple forms, different     
               playing styles and varying degrees of dynamics.         
                                                                       
          The LPC includes over 300 chords played by up, down, fast,   
                              and slow strokes.                        
               The total number of chord samples is over 8,000.        
                                                                       
             - major, minor, 7th, minor 7th, major 7th , add 9th,      
          7th-9th, major 7th-9th, sus 4th, dim 7th, #9th, minor 9th,   
          major 3rd(vibrato), major (picking harmonics), open chords,  
                                     etc.                              
                                                                       
           Clean and Distorted, both timbres of the electric guitar    
                                 are included.                         
                                                                       
          - The "Clean Guitar" samples are recorded in a natural room  
              environment creating a very real quality of sound.       
           - The "Distortion Guitar" samples are recorded through a    
          MarshallÃ‚Â® Amplifier creating a very powerful sound tool for  
                          different musical genres.                    
                                                                       
            Based on our research of testing the quality of sounds     
          through various amp simulators, we compared the difference   
            in quality of a signal recorded from a speaker versus a    
          signal recorded directly from an instrument cable line. We   
          found that the signal recorded through a microphone from a   
          speaker in a studio produces a much more natural sound. So   
            we recorded the clean guitar sound through an AKG C414     
           B-ULS from a Marshall Power Amp Model 9005 and the guitar   
           distortion through a combination of an E.lectroVoice RE20   
            and a Shure SM57 from a Marshall 1959SLP. You can also     
           adjust our clean guitar sound so it suits the music genre   
             you&#039;re working with by adding your favorite amplifier     
                                  simulator.                           
                                                                       
          Picking noises are recorded in multiple forms on all frets   
                                 and strings.                          
                                                                       
           Picking noises made while playing a guitar is one of the    
          most important characteristics that identify a live guitar   
          recording. That is why we took great care in capturing many  
            variations of picking noises. Adding these noises, with    
           consideration to timing and picking style, will make your   
            guitar tracks sound natural. When you use picking noise    
           sampled from a different position of the fret board than    
           the one you&#039;re applying it to, the result is an unnatural   
              sound because the noise will not harmonize with the      
                        original note&#039;s sustain sound.                 
                                                                       
              With our Les Paul Guitar sound library, you get an       
           expansive number of picking noises to work with covering    
          all frets, strings, and playing styles. We promise that you  
           will have all of the samples needed to make truly natural   
                  sounding guitar tracks at your fingertips.

                2. Run Setup.exe to install

                For GigaStudio users:                                  
                1. Unpack                                              
                2. Unrar GIGA_STUDIO.rar                               
                3. Follow instructions in PDF files                    
                4. Buy the stuff if you like it and use it
